AI language model: The transition to autonomous vehicles could have a significant impact on the jobs and livelihoods of those currently working in the transportation industry. The widespread adoption of self-driving cars could disrupt traditional roles such as drivers, dispatchers and maintenance crews, leading to job losses.

However, it is important to note that the technology could also create new job opportunities, such as in software development, engineering, and maintenance for the autonomous vehicles.

Moreover, the adoption of autonomous vehicles is expected to benefit the larger society in many ways, such as reducing accidents, improving traffic efficiency, and decreasing transportation costs. Hence, policymakers may consider the potential benefits of the technology and work towards ensuring that workers who are impacted by this transition have access to opportunities for retraining and reskilling to facilitate a smooth transition to new jobs in the industry.

Overall, while the transition to autonomous vehicles may have a disruptive impact on some jobs, it is also expected to offer significant potential improvements in transportation efficiency and safety.
